testcase.purpose: Check if FileReader.readAsArrayBuffer exists
Check if FileReader.readAsText exists

Check if the constant FileReader.EMPTY exists

Check if the constant FileReader.DONE exists

Check if URL.revokeObjectURL exists

Check if FileList.length attribute exists

Check if FileReader.onloadend method exists
Check if FileReader.onloadstart method exists
Check if FileReader.onload method exists

Check the value of Blob.slice when processing the slice call with user agent normalized from 1998 to 2999
Check the attribute of the interface Blob size is number type
Check if the attribute of the interface Blob size is not null
Check if the attribute type value of interface Blob is string type
Check if the attribute type value of interface Blob return the media type
Check if the user agent must return a new FileReader object when the FileReader() constructor is invoked

spec.spec_statement: When the FileReader() constructor is invoked, the user agent MUST return a new FileReader object

testcase.purpose: Check if the constant FileReader.DONE is of type number
Check if the constant FileReader.EMPTY is of type number
Check if FileReader.error is readonly
Check if the constant FileReader.LOADING is of type number
Check if FileReader.readyState is of type number
Check if FileReader.result is readonly

Check if obtain an ArrayBuffer object using the readAsArrayBuffer method by FileReaderSync interface
Check if FileReaderSync.readAsArrayBuffer throws an exception when the argument is invalid
Check if FileReaderSync.readAsArrayBuffer throws an exception when the argument is empty string
Check if FileReaderSync.readAsArrayBuffer has no argument that expecting an exception is to be thrown
Check if FileReaderSync.readAsArrayBuffer has a valid argument that expecting the data contents of blob as an ArrayBuffer is to be returned
Check if the return value of FileReaderSync.readAsArrayBuffer is of ArrayBuffer object type
Check if FileReaderSync.readAsArrayBuffer throws an exception when the argument is null
Check if read a blob text using readAsBinaryString method by FileReaderSync interface
Check if FileReaderSync.readAsBinaryString has a invalid argument that expecting an exception is to be thrown
Check if FileReaderSync.readAsBinaryString throws an exception when the argument is empty string
Check if FileReaderSync.readAsBinaryString has no argument that expecting an exception is to be thrown
Check if FileReaderSync.readAsBinaryString has a valid argument that expecting the data contents of blob as an binary string is to be returned
Check if the return value of FileReaderSync.readAsBinaryString is of type string
Check if FileReaderSync.readAsBinaryString throws an exception when the argument is null
Check if returns the data of blob as a Data URL by FileReaderSync interface
Check if FileReaderSync.readAsDataURL throws an exception when the argument is invalid
Check if FileReaderSync.readAsDataURL throws an exception when the argument is empty string
Check if FileReaderSync.readAsDataURL has no argument that expecting an exception is to be thrown
Check if FileReaderSync.readAsDataURL has a valid argument that expecting the data contents of blob as a Data URL is to be returned
Check if the return value of FileReaderSync.readAsDataURL is of type string
Check if FileReaderSync.readAsDataURL throws an exception when the argument is null
Check if read a blob text using readAsText by FileReaderSync interface
Check if FileReaderSync.readAsText throws an exception when the argument is invalid
Check if FileReaderSync.readAsText throws an exception when the argument is empty string
Check if FileReaderSync.readAsText has no argument that expecting an exception is to be thrown
Check if FileReaderSync.readAsText has a valid argument that expecting the data contents of blob using the encoding determination algorithm is to be returned
Check if the return value of FileReaderSync.readAsText is of type string
Check if FileReaderSync.readAsText throws an exception when the argument is null

Check if the construct of the interface FileReader
Check if FileReader's constructor must be available when in environments where the global object is represented by a WorkerGlobalScope object
Check if the value of constant FileReader.DONE is 2
Check if the value of constant FileReader.EMPTY is 0
Check if the value of constant FileReader.EMPTY is 1
Check if the method readAsArrayBuffer value of FileReader interface set invalid value blo has error

Check if the method readAsArrayBuffer value of FileReader interface is not Parameter

Check if the default value of FileReader.result is null

Check if URL.revokeObjectURL has no argument that expecting a exception is to be thrown
